headline: Baked Ham and Cheese Sliders
description: These baked ham and cheese sliders feature mini rolls stuffed with deli ham and melted Swiss baked with a savory poppyseed-mustard sauce to make an easy, tasty little bite or appetizer.

video.name: How to Make Baked Ham and Cheese Sliders

name: Baked Ham and Cheese Sliders
recipeIngredient: 1 pound thinly sliced cooked deli ham

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x13-inch baking dish.
Mix butter, Dijon mustard, Worcestershire sauce, poppy seeds, and dried onion in a bowl.

Separate the tops from the bottoms of the rolls; arrange the bottom pieces in a layer in the prepared baking dish. Layer about 1/2 of the ham onto the rolls; add a layer of Swiss cheese and top with remaining ham slices.
Place the tops of the rolls onto the sandwiches. Pour mustard mixture evenly over the rolls
Bake in the preheated oven until the rolls are lightly browned and the cheese has melted, about 20 minutes. Slice into individual rolls through the ham and cheese layers to serve.

review.reviewBody: I had everything but the ham, so I used thinly sliced summer sausage. I also only had six roles, so I had to adjust the amount of sauce. I did cover with foil for the first ten minutes They were wonderful.
Unbelievably delicious! I made them for the Super Bowl and the disappeared like magic!!!
The buns are very fluffy and have a little crunch from being baked. The different flavors are amazing and I'm really picky too!!

I love these, and I always forget to make them. It’s just like deviation this time where they did half of them with white cheddar and ham and the other half with ham and Swiss. Also spread a thin layer of blackberry jam on the bread before I compile them. Also, put a tablespoon of brown sugar in the butter. Mixture before putting it on top. Delicious. Sidenote. These burn pretty quickly at the bottom if not watching what you’re doing. I put a piece of parchment paper to line my pan before I put the sandwiches in the dish.

I made these for a party last night and there was so much good food there, but these sandwiches were ALL everyone kept talking about! I thought for sure these seem too easy and can't be that great - you are basically just putting a sandwich together and baking it, but I was so wrong! They are so simple, but the few ingredients mixed together and the little crispy edge on the roll from baking make these exceptional!! I did play around and use turkey and provolone on half and I didn't use onion because of some picky people I know, but they were still fantastic! Also, I did keep mine covered the entire time I cooked them and even left in the oven on warm for a while. I will definitely be making these again and maybe even for dinner - not just a party!! I would love to try using different rolls, cheese, etc. Great recipe!!!
I’ve always loved snacking on these yummy Sammy’s. Great to have recipe! Tks Sue E
Yummy
My family loved these!
My friend brought these to a NYE party and they were a hit. Absolutely the best dish on the table!!!
I had these the first time n the 80s and have loved them every since. They are addictive.

I made these for brunch and they were a big hit. The only changes I made were using Everything But The Bagel seasoning since I didn't have poppy seeds and I left out the Worcestershire. I will definitely make these again.
I’ve used the poppy seeds for years but now am using Everything Bagel seasoning. OMG! Takes it up to even more delicious!
These were absolutely delicious! We are not fans of Hawaiian rolls and I used regular “slider rolls”. All 8 of us have it 15 stars on a scale of 1-10 hahahaha!

I gave this a 4 because although they were good, when using all this butter, and poured over top, my sliders were soggy mush on the bottom, I WIll Never pour all that in there again, I will brush the tops and that is it... but other than the mush, the flavors were good and I will make again.
Super easy and quick to make. Great game day good.

My 16 year old daughter did this recipe just now and she did a great job, she followed the exact same recipe and they turned out delicious, we give it a 5 out of 5, definitely will be making these again…

I went by this recipe all except I used provolone cheese instead of Swiss! Took them to a Christmas party and everyone loved them. So a few days later took them to another party and they were loved there also. The only thing is their so good they all get gone!
I made this according to the recipe. No changes or substitutions. Exceptional.

Excellent recipe! I used leftover meat and cheese (baked ham and an "italian blend" shredded cheese) but otherwise the same ingredients. I did spoon a few tablespoons over the meat/cheese mixture before I put the top half of the rolls on, and I covered it in foil for 15 minutes. I ended up needing to bake it a little longer w/o the foil to let the topping absorb. But once it did, the sliders tasted great!

12 rolls just about filled the pan. I couldn't find a 24 package but not sure they would fit. In the recipe video it looked like there was 18! I only used half the cheese just because it seemed like not quite enough bread.
Delicious! I did half the sliders with Swiss cheese and half with American (per my daughter’s request). Delicious. Will be making again.

Excellent! We used slices from a baked ham which were probably a bit thicker than deli meat and they were delicious. I also used Everything But the Bagel Seasoning and didn't mix it in with the butter but sprinkled it on about ten minutes before they were done. We split the sandwiches over two pans and froze one--Without the butter on top! We also froze the extra butter mixture. The frozen sandwiches kept well and were just as delicious as the first batch. This shows that you could prep the sandwiches ahead and freeze them. These were absolutely delicious!
my husband loves these! I am not a favorite of ham so I just make em for him and his buddies. they all think I should make a batch & sell them on the corner! lol

I’ve made these a few times and overall, they are very good. I reduce the butter to 1/2 a stick to prevent the rolls from getting soggy and they also taste better for leftovers. We also have turkey and provolone and leave off the poppy seeds. Bake 15 minutes covered with foil and 5 minutes with the foil removed.

I have made this recipe for the past 5 years for our Christmas Eve open house and I never have any left over. I make 2 24 packages of rolls and can have 15 to 35 people show up. Never have I had leftovers! Easy, tasty, and always a hit! I made a vegetarian version for a potluck using peppers and onion in place of the ham and cheddar in place of the swiss. Another great option as they, too, were all gone while other dishes remained hardly touched. Love this recipe!

These were incredible! I added a little garlic powder into the butter mixture that goes on top instead of the poppy seeds and it was great. Both kids and adults devoured these. Will definitely make them again!

Delicious! I had several different meats and cheeses to use up so I did. I did use far less than the required amounts though. Everyone agrees that the taste was perfect but those that were salt sensitive complained. (I used everything bagel instead of poppy seeds). i will tweak it to make it less salty in the future. Also I originally made it and immediately froze it. Thawing and reheating was incredibly easy. I'll definitely make this again when I have deli meats to use up.

I have made this recipe 4 times- each time a HUGE hit!! They disappear!! One suggestion I would like to share. I brush 2/3 of the mustard mixture over the ham & cheese BEFORE placing the top roll on. Then brush the rest of the mustard mixture on top of rolls. Still delicious and not as messy when handling/serving them.
Delicious, a definate hit!

My kiddos loved these. I had to make a few changes- subbed onion powder for minced, used Everything Bagel seasoning instead of poppy seeds and covered for 15 minutes and then let brown for five. These were yummy.

Made these for a party and they were a BIG hit, I didn't change a thing except to cover with foil for the first 15 min, then uncovered until they got nice and toasty. They were so easy to make definitely will be making again.

These sandwiches are absolutely amazing. My family doesn't like onions or Swiss cheese but this combination is amazing! I able this at least once every 2 weeks. We do cut the butter down to 1/2 cup because I make 2 batches and it gets soggy when reheating. On our family favorites list!
These were absolutely delicious! Not to be one of those people, but I did change the cheese because I don't like Swiss cheese at all. I used sliced provolone.
I made no changes to the recipe. We love it just the way it is. I had to make extra because my entire family love these ham and cheese sliders
Easy to make and tasted great.
Cover with foil during the first part of the cooking time.
This was a crowd favorite at a recent luncheon I hosted. I followed the recipe exactly and they turned out great.
Easy and delish! Used Everything Bagel for the onion/ poppyseed.

I think the recipe overlooked one point - the dish should probably be covered during the first part of the cooking time. The tops of my rolls burned and so had to peel those off. Unfortunately, that was where most of the good sounding sauce was also. I plan to try again, but I'll definitely cover it to start out.
Made these for a birthday party. Everyone loved them and requested them for next party too

We are vegetarian so I used sliced mushrooms instead of ham. Family liked it, I think I should have put salt on the mushrooms since they are not salty like ham, also I used Hawaiian rolls and think plain would have been better.
This is one of my all-time favorites! I follow this recipe exactly, and it’s a crowd pleaser every time.
I added a full tsp of honey. Added just the right taste of sweetness! Honey mustard would work as week I am sure! Delish 👍
I made it according to the recipe, except with about half of the cheese. Turned out great!

1/2 stick of butter, 1 tsp of worst. Sauce, 1 tsp of minced onions, 1 tsp of Dijon mustard, 1 tablespoon of poppy seeds!!! 20 mins at 350 covered with HD aluminum foil and 💥 Picture is before I cooked them!!!!
Delicious! Followed the recipe. Great for game day snack or dinner!
Easy to make but doesnt take like it is! Very good, we end up making it about once a week now.

These are the best! I'm asked to bring these at every baby shower, wedding shower, church function, family get-together, etc. They are always devoured quickly. I don't vary anything from the original recipe other than to double or triple the ingredients, or to occasionally sub out turkey and provolone for the ham and swiss. A huge hit and definitely a well-worn recipe card. This one is a keeper!!
Quick and easy. Everyone loved it
I love the recipe. The only thing I did different was the poppy seed. I couldn't find any in my supermarket. This recipe is a staple in our home.
I loved this recipe. My original ham and cheese recipe called for grating a large onion. This put me off making them often because of the mess and the tears. This recipe solves that problem.
My wife LOVES this dish. I don’t change anything and they come out perfect, but I see some people prefer to cover them with foil. Trying this week with ham and turkey for a little change up!
Great recipe! Always a hit. We take ours to the next level with Everything Bagel Seasoning!
Just right. These were really good for lunch or even brunch. Maybe just cut back a little on the butter. Yum yum.

Love these! I got day old rolls, so added a little brown sugar to sweeten sauce since they weren't Hawaiian rolls. I also use yellow mustard as I don't like dijon. So good! Even my picky eater likes them!
I used sun dried tomato turkey and havarti cheese. And everything bagel in place of poppy seeds. It was delicious

Absolutely delicious! I know all these slider recipes call for rolls but I usually don’t have them, I did however have lots of leftover hamburger buns from a cookout and was trying to think of ways to use them and immediately thought of sliders. They turned out so good. I didn’t have Dijon mustard so I just used the same amount of yellow mustard, and also covered them with foil for 10 minutes and then left them in just a couple more minutes uncovered, since I was unsure if they would cook differently than rolls. Also added 3 tablespoons of brown sugar to the sauce like a review suggested and it was amazing. I tested the brown sugar version on half the buns and kept the original recipe on the other side and I definitely prefer the brown sugar side, it adds a delicious sweetness to the recipe. Will definitely be making again!!
Excellent. Served them at a bbq and they were gobbled up. Super easy to make.
It was a spur of the moment fix and even my picky eater loved it
Awesome recipe. Even my 1yr old loved the buns! Changed it up with some Granulated garlic, honey Dijon mustard to boot. Then put on the smoker at 350F for 25 minutes. Delicious! Definitely a kee
I love this recipe! It is my go to for quick easy meals and potlucks!
I used Gouda cheese instead of Swiss. Delish!

This is an awesome recipe! Love that you can make it just like it says and it's perfect or you can switch it up depending on what you like or have on hand. This time I tried the Hawaiian Pretzel buns, absolutely delicious. Grandkids requests it when they come to visit and it so simple to make plus you can make it ahead, refrigerate or freeze and get out when needed. Saves a lot of time if you are having a get-together. Things I've added are honey, honey mustard, brown sugar, Chick-Fil-A sauce, the world is your oyster (or slider as the case may be) Enjoy and be blessed!

I made these for dinner on Hawaiian Rolls using only 12 rolls, 1/2 lb ham, 1/2 pound cheese. I topped them with 1/2 cup melted butter but full amount of other ingredients. I covered the dish in foil and baked as directed. Then I removed the foil to crisp up the tops just a bit. Everybody loved them.
Yummy. Easy to do. Very Satisfying.

I made these today for my woman's study group and all the ladies loved them. They compliment the flavor on the outside and how they were doughy like other times they had them. I had never made them before but i have to say i will be making them again following this recipe. I didn't have poppy seeds so I sprinkled the top with everything but the bagel seasoning and it was a nice touch. Thanks for such a great recipe.

We liked them. I omitted the onion (dietary restrictions) and the poppy seeds (not a fan). Baked covered with foil for the first 10 minutes as other reviewers suggested and 10 minutes uncovered. They were easy to prepare and cut when done. To me they weren't hot enough, but my husband thought that they were just fine. Will definitely make them again.
Easy to make and very tasty.

Never any complaints when I serve these and I do about 3/4 times a year. I seldom use the Hawaiian rolls, at 5.50 a dozen I have found that supermarket dinner rolls are just as great. Also try un or low salt turkey with swiss cheese will be a hit I promise. I made Italian Wedding Soup today and will have with ham sliders in the warmer weather I serve with potato or mac salad.
I liked it I used mustard and powder dry mustard and no onion and lots of butter
I used garlic and parsley instead of Worcestershire sause and the other stuff!! It was amazing!!
These are delicious and easy to make! I add dill pickle or jalapeno slices before baking. (: Yumminess!
Everyone loved them. I used cherrywood ham, cheddar cheese, and everything bagel topping instead of just poppy seeds. Followed the advice of covering with foil half of the cooking time.
It was great and no leftovers say it was well loved!

I agree that it's a good idea to cover with foil during the first half of baking - but, I didn't remember seeing that in the reviews until after I'd made it! No matter; I had four sandwiches leftover but originally planned on serving it to 10 people instead of only 6 so obviously, they were a hit! Now I know I'll need to make a few more for a bigger crowd since people will want to have more than one sandwich per serving.

This recipe made as shown is just okay. I love the concept but it was just kind of bland. I made this a second time, with some personal adaptations. I increased the Worcestershire sauce to 2 Tbsp., added 4 Tbsp. of packed brown sugar & used plain yellow mustard instead of Dijon. The sandwiches were delicious! Made them for my card group the next week and they all raved about them! Now it's definitely a "keeper" recipe!

I made this as written except I only had cheddar jack cheese so that's what I used. I loved these! Very tasty! I used a 12 pack of Kings Hawaiian butter dinner rolls because I couldn't find a 24 pack of dinner rolls that would fit a 9x13 pan. I made the full amount of butter sauce and was worried it would be too much for my 12 rolls, but it wasn't. Even my picky husband liked them. The hint of Dijon flavor along with the other ingredients was delicious . I followed the advice of other reviewers and covered with foil for the first 10 minutes of baking. I would definitely recommend doing this. Overall a very simple and tasty recipe.
I have made these follow the exact recipe. They were delish and a hit with my guests. I have also made them with different protein & cheeses. You definitely need to make these!

I made this for a New Years eve party. For some reason, the mustard mixture consistency was more like a gravy and there wasn't enough sauce to provide a good flavor. Also, the cheese overwhelmed the ham. The only thing I did leave out where the poppy seeds. I'm not sure where I went wrong.
I'd cut back on the butter just a bit, but they were just great!
Delicious. Couple tweaks. I actually fried the ham first. Amazing. Gives much flavor. Also , I added a bit of honey to the topping mix. A great addition.
I've made this several times, exactly as written. We call them Sliders. Everyone always loves them no matter where we take them. They are wonderful!
Love these! Finger lickin' good!
I made 12 of these beauties. My husband and son loved them so much that they ate more than half of them before I remembered to take a picture. They are delicious!!
Very similar to what my Mom used to make. This recipe has been around a long time - thanks for the memories!
My wife makes these and a Buffalo Bleu version every now and then for dinner. Our kids love them. Quick and easy to make and not just for parties.

Made these for years. With the amount of butter sauce (and some additional ham/cheese) you can make 48 rolls... you will need them cause folks scarf them up. I wrap in foil and bake on large cookie sheet at 350F for 30 minutes. Can be assembled up to 24 hr before baking.
Perfect appetizer for a chilly day celebrating with family and friends!

Very tasty and easy to make! I left out the poppy seeds as I realized too late that I was out. I used Swiss cheese as written on half of the sandwiches and American cheese on the other for my daughter. Definitely a keeper!

This ham & cheese party sandwiches recipe is definitely a crowd pleaser. However, the grandson was a bit disappointed that none of them made it back home from the party. 
I made a few simple adjustments (didn’t want to make a trip to the store): I used a combination of provolone and white sharp cheddar cheese and added a little mayonnaise to both sides of the bread. The sandwiches were perfect. I will definitely make these again!
I thought the bottoms of the buns were too soggy. I'm going to try again with less butter.

Perfect, will definitely keep this one. I reduced this recipe by half, used Havarti because I don't like Swiss, and added 3/4 T browns sugar. I used a store brand Hawaiian rolls, that took the sweetness down a notch. I made 6 honey ham and 6 turkey.

My brother-in-law made these sandwiches when I was visiting them. He was out of dried onion flakes so added chopped onions. They were delicious. When I made them, because I love onions, I caramalized two white onions and placed them between the ham and cheese before baking. My friends loved the caramelized onions too. Try it, you'll love them too.

Just made these today , this is my first review . Wow they smell so good. I didn’t have enough money to replace the cheese I had with Swiss so just used havarti . Which turned out great . We used mini brioche buns , white sesame seeds , and honey Dijon as replacements . Used all other same ingredients . Turned out wonderful !
Great for party or luncheon . I substituted a pinch of garlic powder for poppy seed. Peeps ate em up!!!
Super good and easy

Very simply to make. Used this recipe for my son's Birthday party. NOTE: I did not use Dijon mustard nor Worcestershire sauce due to preference. Still turned out lovely. I did cook them covered with foil the first 10 minutes then cooked them the remaining time uncovered. Could have used less poppy seeds than called for.
Awesome recipe!
The recipe was great. I used Canadian Bacon instead of ham, low carb Hot Dog buns instead rolls and Datil Pepper Mustard in place of Dijon.
